item.title: How to convert Mel Spectrogram to wav file
item.description: #Return mel spectrogram to original .wav file import numpy as np import librosa #npy file Melpectrogram reading mel = np.load("melspe.npy") #mel -> audio audio = librosa.feature.inverse.mel_to_audio(mel) Exporting #wav librosa.output.write_wav("audio.wav",audio,22050) #Postscript I had a chance to use it, but I couldn’t find an article, so I wrote it. It would be nice if not… not L… please
